page.title: 20GOVERNMENT
page.content: The village of Morland, in the county of Cumbria and the district of Eden, is administered by a Parish Council of seven elected people. Mr.Willie Howarth is the chairman and the clerk is the schoolmaster,Mr.Davison. The council meet to run the village and solve any problems that might come up.At the moment there is a bad case of pollution in the beck from some silage outflow. The council entered the village for the Cumbria Best Kept Village Competition and one year Morland won it.We were very proud.The certificate is in the village hall. The Parish Council looks after footpaths,bridle ways and open spaces including the village playing field. The money it uses comes from a tax called the Rates and in Morland one penny rate brings in Â£180.
